body_html:
Thank you for the contribution @feihugis.

Is there a particular reason you chose to implement your logic as a dataset (as opposed to providing a more efficient implementation of the MatchingFilesOp kernel)? It makes more sense to me to provide an efficient MatchingFilesOp kernel. That way, your solution will support shuffling (which it currently does not) and will benefit other users of the MatchingFilesOp kernel.

body:
Thank you for the contribution @feihugis. 

Is there a particular reason you chose to implement your logic as a dataset (as opposed to providing a more efficient implementation of the `MatchingFilesOp` kernel)? It makes more sense to me to provide an efficient MatchingFilesOp kernel. That way, your solution will support shuffling (which it currently does not) and will benefit other users of the `MatchingFilesOp` kernel.
